Connects the SiteBuilder to Twisted client.

buildAjax(site)¶

Answer the json of the ajax dict generated by the site. This method gets called if there is a “/ajax” parameter in the url.

buildCss(site)¶

Build the site to CSS.

buildHtml(site)¶

Build the site for HTML.

buildResource(site)¶

The url refers to a xierpa3 resource, try to find it and answer the result with the appropriate mime type.

classmethod codeChanged()¶

Auto-reloading launcher.

getDefaultSiteClass()¶

The @getDefaultSiteClass@ method is used by the task daemon, to get access to the current set of constants. Since the site class contains the specific constants of the site, it can be used to derive the path of DATA storage and to create a shadow builder in the remote process to be called with the @task.method @.

getDefaultThemeName()¶

The @getDefaultThemeName@ method answers the default site name @self.DEFAULTTHEME@.

getDoIndent()¶

The @getDoIndent@ method answers the boolean flag if the output code building should include indents.

getSite(httprequest)¶

The @getSite@ method answers a new instance of the site class that is indicated by the result of @e.getSiteName()@. This site instance typically is derived from the first part of the URL or by the matching domain name. This allows the running of multiple domain names (all with port 80) on the same server.

getTheme(name)¶
getThemeName(httprequest)¶

The @getThemeName@ method answers the name of the current theme. This method should be redefined if there is more than one site to be served through this client, depending on a pattern in the *httprequest * URL. Default behavior is to answer the result of @self.getDefaultSiteName()@.<br/> Note we cannot use @self.e@ to parse the URL, since it cannot be created without a defined site class.

getThemeNames()¶

The @getThemeNames@ method answers the names (keys) of the available sites of this server. Typically this is the list of keys from the dictionary answered by @self.getSites()@.

getThemeTitle(name)¶

The @getThemeTitle@ method answers the class title of named site name. The default behavior is to answer @self.getSiteClass(name).getTitle()@.

getThemes()¶

The @getSites@ answers dictionary with the sites this client runs.

reload()¶
renderError(e, t)¶
renderErrorHead()¶
render_GET(httprequest)¶

The @render_GET@ method is called by Twisted to handle the GET httprequest. It is the main loop (besides the @self.render_POST@) that builds pages from url requests. The site instance is called by @b.build()@. The result (this can be HTML, JSON or binary data) is answered. The application needs to have the right MIME type in the output.

render_POST(httprequest)¶

The @render_POST@ method is called by Twisted to handle the POST httprequest. The site instance is called with @b.build()@. The result (this can be HTML, JSON or binary data) is answered. The application is supposed to have the the right MIME type in the output. The data of the post is located in the file object @httprequest.content@. The data can be read by @ httprequest.content.read()@.

resolveByFile(site, path)¶

Test if the path exists as file. If it does, then answer the content. If forcing then skip. If in /ie then read.

setMimeTypeEncoding(mimeType, request)¶

<doc>The @getMimeTypeEncoding@ method answers the MIME type and coding in format @’text/css; charset-utf-8’@.</doc>

showStartLabel(port)¶

The @showStartLabel@ method is used by the client to show the server information at startup.

showStopLabel()¶

The @showStopLabel@ method is used by the client to show the server information at startup.
